 Gradient is circular.

Private Member Functions

 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (GradientDrawer)

Detailed Description

A Drawer with a color gradient for buttons, backgrounds, etc.

It can be defined in an XML file with the <shape> element.

Definition at line 25 of file GradientDrawer.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::Orientation

Controls how the gradient is oriented relative to the drawer's bounds.

Enumerator:
ORIENTATION_TOP_BOTTOM 

draw the gradient from the top to the bottom

ORIENTATION_TR_BL 

draw the gradient from the top-right to the bottom-left

ORIENTATION_RIGHT_LEFT 

draw the gradient from the right to the left

ORIENTATION_BR_TL 

draw the gradient from the bottom-right to the top-left

ORIENTATION_BOTTOM_TOP 

draw the gradient from the bottom to the top

ORIENTATION_BL_TR 

draw the gradient from the bottom-left to the top-right

ORIENTATION_LEFT_RIGHT 

draw the gradient from the left to the right

ORIENTATION_TL_BR 

draw the gradient from the top-left to the bottom-right

Definition at line 47 of file GradientDrawer.h.

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::draw ( Canvas *  canvas) [virtual]

Draw in its bounds (set via setBounds) respecting optional effects such as alpha (set via setAlpha) and color filter (set via setColorFilter).

Parameters:
canvasThe canvas to draw into

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::getIntrinsicHeight ( ) const [virtual]

Return the intrinsic height of the underlying Drawer object.

Returns -1 if it has no intrinsic height, such as with a solid color.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::getIntrinsicWidth ( ) const [virtual]

Return the intrinsic width of the underlying Drawer object.

Returns -1 if it has no intrinsic width, such as with a solid color.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::getOpacity ( ) const [virtual]

Return the opacity/transparency of this Drawer.

Generally a Drawer should be as conservative as possible with the value it returns. For example, if it contains multiple child drawers and only shows one of them at a time.

Note that the returned value does not take into account a custom alpha that has been applied by the client through the setAlpha methods.

Returns:
int32_t The opacity class of the Drawer.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::getOrientation ( ) const

Returns the orientation of the gradient defined in this drawer.

bool gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::getPadding ( Rect *  padding) const [virtual]

Return in padding the insets suggested by this Drawer for placing content inside the drawer's bounds.

Positive values move toward the center of the Drawer (set Rect::inset). Returns true if this drawer actually has a padding, else false. When false is returned, the padding is always set to 0.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setAlpha ( int32_t  alpha) [virtual]

Specify an alpha value for the drawer.

0 means fully transparent, and 255 means fully opaque.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setColor ( int32_t  argb)

Changes this drawbale to use a single color instead of a gradient.

Note: changing color will affect all instances of a drawable loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing the color.

Parameters:
argbThe color used to fill the shape
See also:
mutate()
void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setColorFilter ( const ColorFilter *  cf) [virtual]

Specify an optional colorFilter for the drawer.

Pass null to remove any filters.

Implements gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setCornerRadii ( const gaia::base::Array< float > &  radii)

Specify radii for each of the 4 corners.

For each corner, the array contains 2 values, [X_radius, Y_radius]. The corners are ordered top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setCornerRadius ( float  radius)

Specify radius for the corners of the gradient.

If this is > 0, then the drawer is drawn in a round-rectangle, rather than a rectangle.

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setDither ( bool  dither) [virtual]

Set to true to have the drawer dither its colors when drawn to a device with fewer than 8-bits per color component.

This can improve the look on those devices, but can also slow down the drawing a little.

Reimplemented from gaia::graphics::Drawer.

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setGradientCenter ( float  x,
float  y 
)

Sets the center location of the gradient.

The radius is honored only when the gradient type is set to RADIAL_GRADIENT or SWEEP_GRADIENT.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing this property.

Parameters:
xThe x coordinate of the gradient's center
yThe y coordinate of the gradient's center
See also:
mutate()
setGradientType(int32_t)
void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setGradientRadius ( float  gradientRadius)

Sets the radius of the gradient.

The radius is honored only when the gradient type is set to RADIAL_GRADIENT.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing this property.

Parameters:
gradientRadiusThe radius of the gradient in pixels
See also:
mutate()
setGradientType(int32_t)
void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setGradientType ( int32_t  gradient)

Sets the type of gradient used by this drawer.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing this property.

Parameters:
gradientThe type of the gradient: LINEAR_GRADIENT, RADIAL_GRADIENT or SWEEP_GRADIENT
See also:
mutate()
void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setOrientation ( Orientation  orientation)

Changes the orientation of the gradient defined in this drawer.

Note: changing orientation will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing the orientation.

Parameters:
orientationThe desired orientation (angle) of the gradient.
void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setShape ( int32_t  shape)

Sets the type of shape used to draw the gradient.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing this property.

Parameters:
shapeThe desired shape for this drawer: LINE, OVAL, RECTANGLE or RING

void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setStroke ( int32_t  width,
int32_t  color 
)

Set the stroke width and color for the drawer.

If width is zero, then no stroke is drawn.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing this property.

Parameters:
widthThe width in pixels of the stroke
colorThe color of the stroke
See also:
mutate()
setStroke(int32_t, int32_t, float, float)
void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setStroke ( int32_t  width,
int32_t  color,
float  dashWidth,
float  dashGap 
)

Set the stroke width and color for the drawer.

If width is zero, then no stroke is drawn. This method can also be used to dash the stroke.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing this property.

Parameters:
widthThe width in pixels of the stroke
colorThe color of the stroke
dashWidthThe length in pixels of the dashes, set to 0 to disable dashes
dashGapThe gap in pixels between dashes
See also:
mutate()
setStroke(int32_t, int32_t)
void gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer::setUseLevel ( bool  useLevel)

Sets whether or not this drawer will honor its level property.

Note: changing this property will affect all instances of a drawer loaded from a resource. It is recommended to invoke mutate() before changing this property.

Parameters:
useLevelTrue if this drawer should honor its level, false otherwise
See also:
mutate()
setLevel(int32_t)
getLevel()
